page.title: 02 How Cogges is changing
page.content: Cogges was once quite separate from Witney. It used to be an important, self-contained village but then got smaller. After many years Witney has grown, and now Cogges has become part of Witney and is now called Witney. After 1066 when William the Conqueror had conquered England he gave one of his friends, a knight named Wadard, (shown on the Bayeau Tapestry) all of this land where we are. An estate, Wadard's Meadow, is named after him. There were an ancient priory a church and many houses and cottages. Now there is not much left of old Cogges just a few of the major buildings. The new housing estates are really seen as part of Witney and people go to Witney for their shopping. A new school was built 4 years ago, Now roads have been built and a new road bridge is planned as now people have to use the footbridge.
